NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF EDUCATIONAL BROADCASTERS
OFFICE OF EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR
14 GREGORY HALL
URBANA, ILLINOIS
April 15, 1958
Dr. Sam I. Becker
Executive Secretary
Television Center
State University of Iowa
Iowa City, Iowa
Dear Sam:
Before Paulu says Skornia "will tell you" (a natural remark, since we
keep the Kellogg "books"), 1*11 react to your letter of April 11.
You can make $2,000.00 worth of plans, for sure. Whether for publications,
projects, meetings, committee travel, or grants-in-aid, or a combination,
will be your committee decision.
As you know, we have a request, still in draft stage, in Ford hands (inÂ¬
formally: it was sent to Weiss; he was routing it for reaction when he
was killed in plane crash). Research was #1 on our new request list
($>87,700.00 per year for five years). We can*t count on this yet. We
may get all, part or none. We*11 have to move fast if and when we do
get it. Some pre-thinking on possible Research Director might be in
order, but I*m too superstitious to suggest your passing this on to anyone.
I would earlier have said I thought we*d get all or part. Now I don*t know.
But we *11 keep trying.
If we need to take an interim trial grant in research, we are also ready
to discuss with Ford a $30,000.00 or so one year grant. This is the same
size as we have currently for engineering. It provides for an engineer,
secretary, space, supplies and expenses and some travel, publication, and
other expense. I trust you* 11 go along with all this.
We had hoped to be further along by now. As it is, you can count on the
minimum, hope for the compromise at least, and pray for the maximum.
I agree with your concerns regarding continuance of grant-in-aid, in view
of our minimal budget, unless we call *em specifically graduate student
grants or some such. To an institution $200.00 or so looks weak in
print, as well as being weak in fact. But we *11 follow any directives
the committee sets up, as we always try to do, subject to Board blessing.
The revised timetable should be a must (for research and other grant-in-aid
programs, I might add).
